Name: Bond Retirement
Description: Principal and interest payments on long-term bond debt of the State of Washington, and costs associated with bond sales.

Name: Department of Social and Health Services
Description: Lead agency charged with serving the health and safety needs of the state’s population.

Name: Governmental Operations
Description: Most state-wide elected officials, and agencies that do not fit neatly into other functional areas.

Name: Higher Education
Description: Support for Washington's 6 four-year institutions and the 34 colleges that make up the community and technical college system, as well as financial aid through the Student Achievement Council.

Name: Judicial
Description: The state Supreme Court, the Court of Appeals, and other state judicial agencies.

Name: Legislative
Description: The state House of Representatives, the Senate, and other legislative agencies.

Name: Natural Resources
Description: Agencies responsible for overseeing environmental quality/resources efforts, promoting outdoor recreation, and managing state lands/waters for resource production and other benefits.

Name: Other Human Services
Description: Other agencies charged with serving the health and safety needs of the state’s population.

Name: Public Schools
Description: State support for public schools, including the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction and funds apportioned to local school districts.

Name: Transportation
Description: Part of the Washington State Patrol and the Department of Licensing; the majority of these agencies’ budgets are appropriated in the state Transportation Budget.
